page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The name Skelton comes from the Anglo- Saxon meaning the village on the shelf. The Church in the village is called St. Michael's. Parts of the church date from 1299 but the last major rebuilding took place in the 18th century. King Edward I came to Skelton Church on his way to do battle with the Scots. A wealthy local man, named Fred Toppin, with American connections gave the money to build the Village Hall. Many of the older houses have interest -ing histories eg. Lamonby Hall and Hardrigg Hall, the latter having a pele tower.
